fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to enter Japanese properly when creating new request type

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a servicedesk project
 # Click “Project settings” > “Request types”
 # Click “Add new request type”
 # Switch to Japanese IME and type “tesuto” in text box

h3. Expected Results
“てすと” will be shown

h3. Actual Results
“tえsうtお” will be shown

h3. Workaround
Copy the string “てすと” in advance and paste it into the text box
fields.summary: Unable to enter Japanese properly when creating new request type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a customer clicks the browser back button in a language in laguage settings the browser doesn't go back. 

Happens across Classic & NG
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a language in language support
 # Click on the browser back button, not the Sidebar button

h3. Expected Results

Browser goes to the previous page.
h3. Actual Results

Browser stays on the page but the URL bar changes.
h3. Workaround

Click the Sidebar button until you get to where you want.
fields.summary: Language support browser back button doesn't work

fields.description:
JSM Cloud painfully lacks customer-facing email logging. Agents respond to customers from within an issue with email, but have NO IDEA whether those messages ever reach their intended target. There is damage to reputation, effectiveness, and relationships. 

Atlassian keeps 2-3 weeks of email logs before dumping them, but each instance must be accessed with a unique support request.

JSDCLOUD-4698 "Provide outgoing email logs" has been active for FOUR YEARS with strong demand and ZERO results. 

SUGGESTION = Show status for each message in the issue (ticket) layout, perhaps in the History tab or a new Notification tab.
fields.summary: Add notification log to JSM issues

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

On team-managed projects, it's not possible to set Time tracking as a required field and also not possible to add it on the rule "Remind people to update empty fields".

With this said, agents can transition issues without logging work.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add Time tracking as an option for the "Remind people to update empty fields" rule on team-managed workflows.
fields.summary: Add Time Tracking on "Remind people to update empty fields" rule

fields.description:
I'd really love to see the ability to add in conditions, post-functions, validators, and triggers in the next-gen service desk work flows. The two rules that currently exist "assign a request to someone" and "update a request field" are nice, but only do so much. 

Suggesting that there's expansion on the rules or reintroduction of transition functionality. 

 

I've poked around a fair amount and haven't found anything discussing this, so apologies if I just missed it.
fields.summary: Workflow Transitions in Next-Gen Service Desks

fields.description:
Create a project that shares its configuration with another project - permission to none Jira admin members.

The client would like to have the ability to allow anyone with the none admin permissions to create a project that shares its configuration with another project.
fields.summary: Create a project that shares its configuration with another project - permission to none Jira admin members

fields.description:
Currently, "You can either search based on objects, or Insight fields on an issue. To select the Object tab, *your rule must have the [_Object_ trigger|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/automation-triggers/#Automationtriggers-Objecttrigger]."* It would be very beneficial to be able to create automation rules with the "Scheduled" trigger that can run against objects in the Insight Object Schemas. This would enable users to run "cleanup" type rules or automated workflows against Object Schemas on a regular basis and would be especially helpful for those who have object data that is populated from multiple sources. 

 

Use Case:

We have many different sources that we use to populate and gather data for our Objects in our schemas. The attribute naming across sources is inconsistent so we have some data that is difficult to track. For example, location data is very different from source to source. So we would like to implement an automation rule that will edit the location attribute of the object based on its IP Address. However, the only way to do this is to use the Object trigger and have the rule run every time an object is created/updated/deleted. For most of our use cases, this is unnecessary and the rules often fail due to throttling because there is no way to control what types of object the rule will trigger for. Allowing users to run a scheduled rule that use IQL to look for objects in a schema, would increase the capabilities of the tool and allow for users to solve use cases like this. 

 

!image-2021-06-22-09-24-30-940.png!

 

!image-2021-06-22-09-25-00-369.png!
fields.summary: Add the ability to run scheduled automation rules against Insight Objects.

fields.description:
Hello, it is currently impossible to hide the system field "request type" in JSM.
I would like to hide this field in my field configuration as I do not need it for the subtask issuetypes (sub task cannot be mapped to request type anyway so why make even this field compulsory viewable for all issuetype?).
Removing the "request type" field from the subtasks screen unfortunately does not hide it from the issue view.
This is why I would like to be able to hide it from the field configuration settings.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Impossible to hide the "request type" field in field configurations

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently when an issue us resolved or closed, it stays on the same page the issue was closed.

Customers would like to be able to configure the workflow so that once a team member closes a ticket it automatically takes them back to the queues they were working on.

 

Regards,
fields.summary: Return to queue after closing ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pressing Enter/Return on Date Field will submit the request instead of selecting the informed date

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a request type with a visible date picker field
 # type in your a date
 # Press Enter/Return

h3. Expected Results
The informed date is added to the field and you can add more info on the form

h3. Actual Results
Pressing enter will attempt to submit the form as it is currently filled, even if the date picker pop-up is still open

h3. Workaround

Click the a date on the pop-up
fields.summary: Pressing Enter/Return on Date Field will submit the request instead of selecting the informed date

fields.description:
h3. Problem description

When a JSM portal user is migrated to Atlassian account, they will receive a notification; letting them know about the change.

h3. Suggested resolution

Have a feature to disable these notification.
fields.summary: Disable notification for portal user to Atlassian account migration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The client does not want to use the '*include sub task*' option to club the time spent in parent and child tasks. Instead, we are looking for a smart value that can be used in the Automation for Jira so that it can be copied to custom fields.
h3. Suggested Workaround:

Use the option 'include sub task' to update the time logged and parent + subtasks and then this value can be copied further.
fields.summary: smart value for time logged in parent and child issue together

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time when we edit an issue to update the Insight objects, automation will replace the current list of objects. For other Jira fields, we have an option to append the new values using the new value along with the *copy from issue* option: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Automation to append Insight objects when using the Edit issue action just like other Jira fields
fields.summary: Ability to append Insight objects when using the Edit issue action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At insight, there is "User" attributes type that are linked to JIRA user or customer account. In JIRA ticket , if the customer are set as "Reporter" and also as the Insight object value , we can identify that the automation smart value didn't return the user email address from the object , but it only return email address from reporter smart value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add "User" attribute type in Insight Object type
 # Create an object and update the User attribute with portal only customer account. 
# Create Insight object custom field and add to the request form or create issue screen.
# Create an issue and update the Insight custom field with the object that have User attribute updated with portal only customer , and also add the portal only customer as reporter.
# In automation configuration , use "Issue Created" trigger and use the log action to get the smart value below  :-
{noformat}
Reporter email address : issue.reporter.emailAddress
Object email address : issue.Insight Object field.User.emailAddress
{noformat}
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 3.53.11 pm.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-21 at 3.56.00 pm.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
Allow automation for jira to get User email address despite the user profile is a customer account , or if the user profile email address set to "Only you and admin".

h3. Actual Results
Automation smart value not able to retrieve user email address based on "User" attribute type.

h3. Workaround
Create a separate text attribute in Insight and manually update the user email address. Then , use the attribute to get the email address value.
fields.summary: Object smart value for "User" doesn't return User email address.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ticket stuck in approval state after an approver is deleted
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-user picker custom field and put a non-alphanumeric character in the field name e.g '&'
 # Configure an approval step using the new custom field.
 # Have the approval stage set with 100 % approval.
 #  Add 2 approvers.
 #  approver approves the ticket and deletes other approver.
 #  The ticket is stuck in a state “Submitting approval”
 

h3. Expected Results

The ticket should transition
h3. Actual Results

The ticket is stuck in a state “Submitting approval...
h3. Workaround

Add approver again and have them approve the ticket.
fields.summary: Deleting an approver on approvals results in the issue being stuck if the approvals field contains characters that need to be encoded

fields.description: We are using insight together with JIRA service desk and uses insight to keep track of the customer assets being supported. Hence, we ask the customer to specify which asset they need help with. Customers is only aloowed to see their assets, hence we add their customer portal login to the objects they are allowed to pick. The feature request is to make it possible to add an organization as an attribute directly. So that all users belongin to that organizations can view the insight object.BR,Viktor
fields.summary: Possibility to add an organization to an insight object attribute

fields.description:
I would like to know if it's possible to add the quick-search bar inside the group category

I can see it on the main portal:

!image-2021-06-18-08-19-16-532.png|width=523,height=150!

But when I go inside the portals, the bar is lost:

!image-2021-06-18-08-20-05-182.png|width=353,height=279!

How can I enable it?
fields.summary: Quick Search bar in groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an email request that contains an attachment file larger than 5 MB is sent to a service project mail address, the email request gets bounced back, even if the total email size is smaller than 25 MB.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email request to a service project with an attachment that is larger than 5 MB.

h3. Expected Results

The email request gets created to a ticket in the service project.

h3. Actual Results

The email request did not get created as a ticket in the service project. Nothing on the email request logs. The email request is bounced back with the following message:

 !Screen Shot 2021-06-18 at 16.40.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Email Requests with body size that is larger than 2 MB get bounced back

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, approvals are displayed *only* on the "Comments" section of ticket activity, with the change of status being displayed on the "History" section.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Have the "History" section also showing that a given transition was due to the approval step being completed.
fields.summary: Display approvals on the "History" section of a ticket on the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:
Currently, to change the name of each status visible to the customer on the portal admins have to edit each request type -> make changes -> save.

This is tedious for projects that have many Request Types. This feature would ease the process of changing the names considerably.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Allow the bulk update of the workflow status names for at least the request types using the same workflow additionally with the current behavior.
fields.summary: Allow the bulk update of workflow status names visible to customers for issue types using the same workflow

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this time in the Send email action of automation, we can either select a group custom field or select a group name directly. We don't have a way to send the email to the group type attribute of an Insight object custom field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to use Send email action for Insight group attribute using a smartvalue like {{InsightObject.AssignedGroup}} 

h3. Workaround
At this time, you need to copy the Insight object group attribute {{InsightObject.AssignedGroup}}  to a Jira group type custom field first and then specify the group custom field in the Send email action.
fields.summary: Ability to use Send email action for Insight group attribute

fields.description:
As an IT content manager, I want to use Confluence Questions as a community forum inside the IT Knowledge Base to help identify opportunities for new articles and content.

I would like the JSM portal to search past questions and encourage people to ask the community if there are no results. 

I would like related Confluence articles to be suggested to people as they type their answer. 

I really want to be able to see all my Slack requests, Confluence Questions, Confluence Analytics and Jira Service Desk requests in one place, I would like to easily create a new help article based on the answers given to similar questions, similar to how Insight chat does this.

I need to be able to export one report that has all my service desk reporting and confluence analytics in one place.

I would like to see how many articles have been created from a question.

As an admin, I would like to see what categories have the most questions.
fields.summary: Confluence Questions for IT Support

fields.description: We would like the ability to comment on Objects like we can do in the On-Premise Insight.
fields.summary: Ability to add comments to Insight Objects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for values in the Affected services field, the options suggested flicker and sometimes not all the relevant options are displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Affected services field to the screen and the Description fields of a request type
 # Create a request of this type
 # Try to fill the field from the issue view

h3. Expected Results

All relevant values will appear without flickering as you type.
h3. Actual Results

Suggestions flicker and some relevant options disappear.
 Video: [^affected_services.mov] 
h3. Workaround

None at the moment
fields.summary: Affected Services field flickers when searching for values

fields.description:
h3. Problem desctription
If an ITSM project is only used specifically for Change Management, having the "Alerts" and "On call" buttons are not useful and could be confusing the end-users.

h3. Suggestion
Add the ability to remove the Operation buttons to enable the administrators to specify what is displayed for end users
fields.summary: Ability to remove the project's Operation "Alerts" and "On call" button in an ITSM project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Export does not work on the parent object type for inherited Objects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Parent Object Type with inheritance
 # Create some Children Object Types with Objects
 # Select the bulk action cog on the Parent Object Type. (Note the # of Objects for Bulk Action)
 # Export the Objects.

h3. Expected Results
Objects are exported successfully.

h3. Actual Results
No Objects are exported

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Export does not work on the parent object type for inherited Objects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Querying JSM Insight endpoint '/v1/object/navlist/iql' times out with 504 error when object schema has a lot of objects with user references. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a request to that IQL endpoint under object schema with large amount of objects

h3. Expected Results

Successful response on the provided query. 
h3. Actual Results

Request is timed out with 504.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Querying JSM Insight endpoint '/v1/object/navlist/iql' times out

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Allow JSM admins to remove "There's nothing in this service project yet" in customer portal when all request types are set to "Hidden from portal"
 !image-2021-06-15-16-37-51-602.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-06-15-16-38-20-139.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the option to set/unset the phrase

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Allow JSM admins to remove "There's nothing in this service project yet" in customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using connectedTickets with multiple results times out due to the size of the query.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run an query with connectedTickets that queries a large amount of issues and objects

h3. Expected Results

The query returns with the objects being connected to the issues mentioned in the JQL.
h3. Actual Results

The query times out.
h3. Workaround

Use a subset of the initial query.
fields.summary: Using connectedTickets with multiple results times out

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JSM with Opsgenie merged does not allow free stakeholders. These users would need to be licensed towards JSM in order to be stakeholders.
h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to add free stakeholders in merged Opsgenie
fields.summary: Ability to add free stakeholders in merged Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
PDF attachment file on knowledge base linked to Jira Service Management is showing option to "Edit file" regardless of user/customer's Confluence permission. 

 !image-2021-06-15-11-50-37-963.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove "Edit file" option for users/customers that do not have view permission or Confluence license.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: PDF attachment file on knowledge base linked to Jira Service Management is showing option to "Edit file" regardless of user's Confluence permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As of now, the legacy Insight app are no longer available for new subscription as per mention in [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-are-the-differences-between-insight-in-cloud-and-server/|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-are-the-differences-between-insight-in-cloud-and-server/] . It is best to put disclaimer or information at https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-is-asset-management-for-team-managed-projects/ documentation too , as currently when new user tried to install the app , it no longer available.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-is-asset-management-for-team-managed-projects/ documentation about the app no longer available for new subscription.

On top of that , include that the new Insight app with JSM premium and Enterpise are not supported for Team Managed project.
fields.summary: Update the "What is asset management for team-managed projects?" documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding 2 or more request types to a JSM Team-managed project and editing a workflow always returns "We couldn't save your changes".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a fresh JSM Team-managed project, create 2 request types
 !image-2021-06-15-09-48-33-168.png|thumbnail! 
 # Edit one of the request types' workflow
  !image-2021-06-15-09-49-37-735.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on "Save and close" and error shows up
 !image-2021-06-15-09-50-18-842.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on "Save and close" should save the draft

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on "Save and close" doesn't execute and returns error message "We couldn't save your changes".

The below exception is thrown in the network.log file:
{noformat}
Status name [reopened] must be case-insensitively unique but is being shared between statuses 598a6daf-8713-4f00-ba00-c6c40cdc02b4, 0e247c54-88f1-4a87-be46-4010f8e6835d
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
# Add 1 request type and edit the workflow *by adding a dummy status*
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on "Save and close"
# Add another request type
# Editing and saving workflows no longer returns "We couldn't save your changes" and successfully saves the changes.
fields.summary: Adding 2 or more request types to a JSM Team-managed project and editing a workflow always returns "We couldn't save your changes".

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When customers interact or creates objects the response take a long time and the connection is dropped before a response is sent back. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Depends on the customer data (many users seem to be one of the reasons)
 # Just call 'navlist', '/object/\{id}' or 'create' (navlist is the worst offender here, returning multiple objects, but the other can show the same behaviour if repeatedly called through the api) 

h3. Expected Results

When a customer calls the API either through the UI or api-gateway a response is sent back in a reasonable time.
h3. Actual Results

ObjectResource requests return 504 and 502
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Loading data through the ObjectResource api times out in legacy Insight

fields.description: Greetings, I'd like to suggest being able to customize or delete the default ITSM categories. The reason why I make this suggestion is because sometimes people only want one 'bucket' to see everything and the multiple places to look will make it more confusing.
fields.summary: Customizing or deleting ITSM categories

fields.description:
Hi,

If I want attach a screenshot ,I have to first do a ctrl-v in MSPaint and then save it as a file.Then I have to upload this file via browsing and selecting it to using drag-and-drop

Why so many steps? It would be great to  be able to hit "Print Screen" and directly paste the screen shot in the support form by pressing ctrl-v.

 

-regards

Akash
fields.summary: Supporting Ctrl-V in support requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Not able to load the Affected services field on an issue when the number of services exceeds 20.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with 21 Affected services
 # Browse the issue

h3. Expected Results

Able to view the Affected services field.
h3. Actual Results

The Affected services field fails to load with error "_We couldn’t retrieve the affected service details_."
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not able to load the Affected services field on an issue when the number of services exceeds 20

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When importing a CSV file into Insight the import engine always creates a new object type called "CSV Import". This is not very user friendly as the customer might require to map the object type to an existing object type in their schema. And probably they will not need an object type with a hardcoded name called "CSV Import"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create any import pre def structure and config
 # Observe the newly created object type

h3. Expected Results

The engine should work like other imports by detecting the object type name from the CSV file (could be an additional column) or asks the user view the UI to input the object type name/actually refers the user to a predefined object type if exists (does not work currently and forces the user to create predef structure and config)
h3. Actual Results

The user has to click on create predefined structure and config which creates the CSV Import object type
 h3. Workaround
 # Click on create predefined structure
 # Click on created predefined configuration
 # Go to the cog icon next to the CSV Import object type mapping
 # Click on delete
 # Manually create the Object type mapping
fields.summary: Insight - Improving CSV import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When loading tickets, insight try to load tickets that no longer exists and Jira returns an error
{code:java}
/rest/insight/1.0/objectconnectedtickets/xx/tickets?limit=10
{code}
Connected tickets data is stored in the OBJ_TICKET table
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create data row in the OBJ_TICKET table with a ticketId pointing to a ticket that doesn't exists
 # Restart the instance, this is because the data is cached and reindex in cloud only occurs at startup
 # Try load the object associated with the above ticket connection 

h3. Expected Results

A list of max 10 connected tickets should be visible when viewing the object
h3. Actual Results

The below is from the jira-adapter log:
{noformat}
Failed to query Jira, code: 400, message: , request body: SearchRequest(startAt=0, maxResults=50, jql=id in (10291,10124,10156,10201,10443) and resolution is empty), response body: {\"errorMessages\":[\"A value with ID '10124' does not exist for the field 'id'.\"],\"warningMessages\":[]}, Response{protocol=h2, code=400, message=, url=https://roborigger.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Loading connected issues in legacy Insight fails

fields.description:
Currently the Customer Satisfaction survey can only be edited while the feature is enabled or turned on. 
 !image-2021-06-11-15-08-36-448.png|thumbnail! 

However, when the feature is turned off, the box for editing the survey disappears.
 !image-2021-06-11-15-09-39-980.png|thumbnail! 

The survey editing box should be present while feature is disabled or turned off, to enable hot editing.
fields.summary: Allow editing of Customer Satisfaction survey while disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Agents when given permission are not able to update announcements on the help center.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1: Allow agents from the global configuration page ability to update the help center announcements
 Step2: Go to the help center and try to update help center announcements.
h3. Expected Results

Agents should be successfully allowed to manage help center announcements when given permissions. 
h3. Actual Results

Agents are getting 403 errors on updating the help center announcement.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The announcements are actually successfully saved so if you reload the page updated announcement will be shown
fields.summary: Agents are not able to update help center announcements

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A customer portal may have multiple projects and the customer might get confused as to which project should they raise their request.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a wizard based page with a number of questions that at the end of this wizard will redirect the customer to the right project that they need to raise the request on based on their answers to these predefined questions.
fields.summary: Introduce a wizard to identify which project a customer should raise a request

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

When a customer creates a ticket on the portal, the details will be expanded by default.

It happens for both portal and agent view.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add an option for the administrators to select if by default the details will be expanded or not (both portal and agent view).
fields.summary: Ability to configure the default behavior for Show/Hide details on portal and agent view

fields.description:
Problem Definition:

filter the list of reporters for the agents in the new-issue screen of our next-gen projects. This would minimize the risk of the agent accidentally creating an issue for a customer who is not actually a customer of that particular project.

This is needed to prevent accidental emails to customers which do not belong to that project.

Suggestions  :
Customer use-case:
Project A, contains Ben and Mary.
Project B, contains Jane.

When customer create a ticket in project B, it lists Ben, Mary and Jane. Customers want it to only list Jane.

Workaround :
NA
fields.summary: filter the list of reporters for the agents in the new-issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem

During the Insight export process, the CSV output does not display the actual Insight objects names for the Insight object custom fields. Instead, those are represented as an internal key in format <WorkspaceID>:<ObjectKeyNumber>
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

After export, CSV outputs should show Insight object names or object keys in the columns for Insight object custom fields.
h3. Why This Is Important

Unable to get complete data during exports impacting management reports
h3. Workaround

Process the exports with another tool and make [a GET request|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/insight/rest/api-group-object/#api-object-id-get] to each object to get further details, eg:

[https://your-site.atlassian.net/gateway/api/jsm/insight/workspace/da04fd14-5269-4248-905a-########a3fb/v1/object/1184]
fields.summary: Add the ability to export Insight field value instead of internal key during CSV export

fields.description:
I know this sounds like a duplicate of JRA-7659, but that one is about the perfect generic solution to the user picker problem.

This issue here is about a basic (small) but necessary improvement: don't show users who don't have access to jira!

Most people will benefit from it, since almost any jira instance will have some old users accounts floating around, which have no access to the instance anymore (because they left the company, or...). It is even possible to select Portal Only customer as a reporter and project roles for non-Jira Service Desk issues.
h3. *Steps to replicate*

Scenario 1
 # Invite User as a Portal Only customer
 # Go to *Project Settings*
 # Click on *People* and *add People*.
 # Type a Portal only customer and add any roles.
 # "GG" audit Log

Scenario 2
 # Invite User to your instance (and revoke access to Jira) or as a Portal Only customer
 # Create an issue
 # Select the User who doesn't have Jira access or Portal Only customer as the reporter

h3. *Expected*
 - User who doesn't have Jira access or Portal Only customer isn't visible through the reporter/user picker list
 - User who doesn't have Jira access or Portal Only customer can't be assign to Project Roles

h3. *Actual Result*
 - User who doesn't have Jira access or Portal Only customer can be added on Project Roles
 !Screenshot 2019-04-10 at 10.46.49 AM.png|width=528,height=161!
 - They can also be assigned to any Roles
 !Screenshot 2019-04-10 at 10.48.53 AM.png|width=621,height=93!
 - Audit Log show the portal only customers ID Starting with "qm:..."
 !Screenshot 2019-04-10 at 10.50.12 AM.png|width=1098,height=298!
 - User who doesn't have Jira access or Portal Only customer able to be selected as the reporter (even for non-Jira Service Desk issues)
 !Screenshot 2019-04-10 at 10.53.16 AM.png!

h3. *Suggestion*

Hide or Restrict the Portal Only Customer/User without access from appearing on projects where they shouldn't be.
fields.summary: Don't show users (or Portal Only Customer) who doesn't have Jira application access to appear on reporters and project roles list

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

After the rebranding of JSM, the new cloud sites show '*jira-service-management*' everywhere but for the old cloud sites the project roles, their description, and user groups still have '*jira-service-desk*' in their name instead of *'jira-service-management'*
h3. !image-2021-06-04-13-17-21-083.png|width=210,height=81!

!image-2021-06-04-13-16-00-976.png|width=231,height=89!
h3. Suggested Solution:

Please update the name and description so that all the sites show the same nomenclature.
h3. Why this is important:

The old sites should be the same and updated as the new ones in every manner.
h3.
fields.summary: update the name of the user-groups and project roles from 'Service Desk' to 'Service Management'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, Insight import only allow CSV, JSON and Discovery type. It will be great if there are options to import data from Atlassian Access user profile to Insight

h3. Suggested Solution
Option to import data from Atlassian Access profile data.

h3. Workaround
Create custom script to extract the Atlassian Access data via REST API and create Object to Insight via REST API
fields.summary: Have Importing Tool/Connector to import data from Atlassian Access profile to Insight

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some customers would like to be able to stop receiving CSAT survey for themselves.  Currently there is no way for an end user to opt-out of receiving these.  JSM is designed to automatically send these out when an issue gains a resolution value.  
The only option right now is for a project admin to enable or disable CSAT for the entire project.  There is no kind of exemption list of users that might not want to receiving such survey requests.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Create a means for end users (users in the customer role) to be able to opt out of receiving CSAT survey emails.
* Ideally this would provide options on a per project and/or per site basis.

h3. Why this is important
* Some customers find CSAT requests an additional annoyance, but yet they have no means to stop requesting such emails reach them.
* There is no way for any user to opt out of receiving these when the project has them enabled

h3. Workaround 
no workaround is currently possible for this.
fields.summary: Allow customers to opt-out of receiving CSAT survey email notifications
Include service desk "description" response from GET service desk REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Changing name of space after linking the space to a Jira Service Management project shows old name in:

https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PROJECT-KEY>/knowledge/articles

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to "https://<Site-Name>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<Project-Key>/settings/confluence-kb"
 # Link a Confluence space
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnailwidth=200,height=100! 
 # Go to space settings and change the space name
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnailwidth=200,height=100! 
 # JSM is showing the old space name at "*https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PROJECT-KEY>/knowledge/articles*" for all related articles.

h3. Expected Results

JSM should show the updated name

h3. Actual Results

JSM shows the old name instead of new
h3. Workaround

The JSM project admin must unlink the space and link again for the space name to be updated AND update *each* article for the space name to update itself.
 !image-2021-06-03-09-52-46-533.png|thumbnailwidth=200,height=100!
fields.summary: Changing name of space that is linked to Jira Service Management Team-Managed Project does not show new space name when browsing articles

fields.description:
We need the ability to hide the organisation names from the customer portal that a customer is a member of, they should be able to see the tickets assigned to the organizations but hide the organizations from the list.

 !image-2021-06-02-13-11-16-556.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to hide the organisation names from the customer portal that the customer has membership to

fields.description:
*Update July 2nd, 2021*

*Hello all,*

*We are currently in progress of consolidating the JSM incident object with the Opsgenie capabilities. In addition, we are about to ship the ability to turn on Incident Management in non ITSM projects. This should solve the ask of this ticket.* 

*Stay tuned!*

*Liron*

*Principal Product Manager*

*Jira Service Management*

 

*Summary*

In the current setup, you can link JSM incident tickets to an Opsgenie alert only if the incident ticket is created in an ITSM project.

*Feature Requested*

The customers have pre-existing projects which are of non-ITSM type. It will be a difficult task to create a new ITSM project and migrate all the tickets and data from the old project to the new ITSM project to avail this feature.

Hence, they need functionality to link JSM tickets from a non-ITSM JSM project to the Opsgenie alert.
fields.summary: Feature to link JSM tickets from a non-ITSM JSM project to the Opsgenie alert

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you attempt to view the Inbound References for an object in an Insight instance where there are many Inbound References, the Inbound References component may not load.  Also, attempting to view the Object Graph on an object in an Insight instance where there are many Inbound References may result in the Object Graph view failing to load.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Insight Tab -> View all Object Schemas
 # Click on your Object Schema
 # Click on your Object Type
 # Click on one of your Objects that has Inbound References (Inbound References doesn’t load/Loading bar stays there) 504 timeout in console
 # Click on Object Graph (Object graph doesn’t load/Blank whitespace) 504 in console

h3. Expected Results

We would expect the Inbound References component to load and for us to be able to view the Object Graph
h3. Actual Results

The Inbound References component fails to load or has a permanent loading bar. 

Or

The Object Graph view fails to load.

In both cases, there will be a 504 error in the web console on a REST call to the Insight service
h3. Workaround

Refreshing the page may result in the component or view working.
fields.summary: Attempting to view Inbound References or Object Graph results in component not loading

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During object import, objects are duplicated when object type mapping has two identifiers and one is another referenced object
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create object type called "City" in your schema (with just default attributes) 
 # Also create an object type called "Employee" with the default attributes and an attribute of "City" of the City object type created in step 1
 # Create an import configuration in your schema with the attached CSV file
 # After the configuration is created, create an object type mapping within the configuration selecting the Employee object type created in step 2 and set the identifiers of the mapping to be "Name" and "City" and ensure both are ticked (See screenshot for end result of import configuration)
 ## Ensure that for the Employee object type mapping, Missing objects are ignored
 # Execute import and check that the objects were correctly imported
 # Execute import another time without making any changes

!Screen Shot 2021-06-01 at 12.06.08 pm.png|width=525,height=261!
h3. Expected Results

We should see no duplicates
h3. Actual Results

 

We see duplicates of all the objects
{noformat}
 {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Import duplication when object type mapping has two identifiers and one is another referenced object

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing name of space that is linked to Jira Service Management Team-Managed Project does not show new space name
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to "https://<Site-Name>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<Project-Key>/settings/confluence-kb"
 # Link a Confluence space
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-01 at 10.56.09.png|width=200,height=100!
 # Go to space settings and change the space name
 !image-2021-06-01-10-57-01-776.png|width=200,height=100!
 # JSM is showing the old name at "*https://<Site-Name>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<Project-Key>/settings/confluence-kb*"

h3. Expected Results

JSM should show the updated name

h3. Actual Results

JSM shows the old name instead of new
h3. Workaround

The JSM project admin must unlink the space and link again for the space name to be updated.
fields.summary: Changing name of space that is linked to Jira Service Management Team-Managed Project does not show new space name

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have endpoints to update request type configuration:
* Agent view
* request form
* workflow status

When it would be helpful: Updating large amounts of request types.
fields.summary: Request type configuration endpoints for REST API

fields.description:
We have an issue, that when the employee from service desk team sends an email to the support email , this information appears twice- as a task and as a service request 

 

3608 and 3607

[https://doandco.atlassian.net/browse/GLOBAL-3608]

[https://doandco.atlassian.net/browse/GLOBAL-3607]
fields.summary: After forwarding an email by service desk  team employee service request /task appear (twice)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, customer permissions allow portal users to view users from the project or from their organisation.
h3. Suggested Solution
 Allow portal customers browsing users from different projects
fields.summary: Allow portal customers browsing users from different projects

fields.description: It would be of great use to have an endpoint in JSM API that allows to set customer portal announcements so that we can update these outside of the UI.
fields.summary: Add API end point to set customer portal announcements

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Portal-only customer is unable to retrieve attachment versions of the PDF attached in the knowledge base

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence space integrated with the JSM project.
 # Attach some sample PDF documents to the page using the *//attach* keyword.
 # Log into the customer portal using portal-only customer.
 # Try accessing the PDF documents attached to the knowledge base page in the portal

h3. Expected Results
The attachments should be shown as they are visible on the Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
Below error is received while browsing through the attachments:

Error retrieving attachment versions.

 !image-2021-05-28-11-43-04-947.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Portal-only customer is unable to retrieve attachment versions of attachments on the knowledge base page of the portal

fields.description: Currently maintenance can only be scheduled ad-hoc. It would be useful to be able to set up a recurring schedule to maintain this.
fields.summary: Allow recurring scheduled maintenance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

When attempting to access Jira service management specific features without administrator project permission the error message will show *Generic message"*
Something went wrong
This request type could not be loaded. try reloading the page
Try again
h3. Proposed Solution

Improve the error message by mentioning "You need project administrator permissions to edit this option" would be great.
fields.summary: Improve the error message for permission related issues in Jira Service Management

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

users are unable to delete object type attributes when they have set up multiple import configurations that are associated with that same attribute.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up 2x import configurations so that they map to the same attribute/object type
 # Try to delete that attribute from above from its object type

h3. Expected Results

User can delete the attribute
h3. Actual Results

The user cannot delete the attribute and is faced with a 500 error
h3. Workaround

You can remove one of the attribute mappings from one of the configurations. 
Alternatively you could delete the whole import configuration.
Just make sure that there's only one mapping for an attribute.
fields.summary: User cannot delete an attribute if it is associated to more than one import configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "Find Similar requests" is only available to the non-ITSM projects. It would be great to have the feature with ITSM projects as well.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the "Find Similar requests" to ITSM project templates
fields.summary: Add the "Find Similar requests" to ITSM project templates

fields.description:
Hi! I'd like to use Jira Service Management for [deployment gating|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/set-up-deployment-gating/] of Flagger canaries.

[Flagger|https://flagger.app] is a canary release operator for Kubernetes and allows [manual gates|https://docs.flagger.app/usage/webhooks#manual-gating] to be implemented into the deployment process.
fields.summary: Deployment gating for Flagger

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

{color:#1d1c1d}When a person with a german locale uses JQL with a field name instead of the ID (which is a 100% valid case). Jira is trying to resolve the field by its name and fails since the name is localised and doesn't match one in cache. {color}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a translation for your field
 # Change your user language to the language you used to translate your field
 # Execute a JQL with an IQL that would return more than 1 result

h3. Expected Results

The JQL works
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown.
h3. Workaround

Change the language to English

Alternatively use a field ID when performing a search
fields.summary: Customers can't execute and IQL search if their language is not English

fields.description:
Hello, 

 

I would like too suggest the ability to create a tag for multiple users within one of our customer organisation, rather than adding them as requested participants individually. 

 

Thanks,

Kate Hewett
fields.summary: Tags for multiple customers within one organisation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently the "Requests" columns are limited to system fields only. It would be great to have the ability to add custom fields to the columns as well
h3. Suggestion
Add custom fields as options to the columns
fields.summary: Ability to add custom fields to "Requests"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we do not have a way to backup Insight data. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to backup Insight objects and insight configuration 

h3. Workaround
Customers have to manually export the object types. Once the new Insight REST API is available you will be able to use API calls to export objects and keep their backup: JSDCLOUD-9879. Soon the object schema level exports will be available as well with JSM Insight.
fields.summary: Ability to backup Insight data

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, on Automation for Jira, while it's possible to set a condition from an IQL lookup, it's not possible to trigger action(s) from an IQL lookup query. It will be great if there's a possibility to trigger an action in the automation rule from an IQL lookup.
fields.summary: Automations for Insight: Ability to to trigger the next action(s) from an IQL lookup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a request with multiple approvals is canceled/closed and was not approved or declined, it will remove all approval history on the request

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request with multiple approvals
# Set the user to yourself
# Approve the request on one status
# Cancel the request

h3. Expected Results
The canceled approval removed from the request while the approved/declined in the previous status record remains
h3. Actual Results
All approvals history are removed from the request

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Canceling/closing a request with approvals removes all approval history on the request

fields.description:
Hi there,

Reassignment count is an important metric for us to understand whether our issues are getting to the right resources first time or bouncing around so we can address and improve those areas.

I expected this to be something available out of the box as it's fairly standard in other ITSMs.

I've done a custom solution with automation as a workaround but could this just be added to JIRAs default metrics?

Kind regards,
Dave
fields.summary: Metric - Assignment Count

fields.description:
Internal: 

Keyonna Taylor created on behalf of customer: Mercadolibre

Customer would like the ability to search the audit log of a particular rule (all set up on Classic)to troubleshoot. How to identify a specific time Frame of audit logs or event.

Automatically see or monitor/manage if a rule is enable or disabled.  

IMPACT This is too manual right now that investigating it can take up so much time they may miss an SLA (*impact the end customer as well as company KPIs)*
fields.summary: Search specific Audit trail for easier Troubleshooting | Mercadolibre

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for an Organization in the issue view, when an ampersand (&) is added, the searching will only look for entries with the search term up to the ampersand sign. This may result in erratic behavior in the search field in case there are more than 10 Organizations that match the search string up to the ampersand (&) sign.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Have more than 10 Organizations that have the following name composition:
 * {color:#00875a}_n_ letters{color}{color:#de350b}&{color}, {color:#00875a}_n_ letters{color}{color:#4c9aff}__space__{color}{color:#de350b}&{color}, {color:#00875a}_n_ letters{color}{color:#de350b}&{color}_n_ letters, {color:#00875a}_n_ letters{color}{color:#4c9aff}__space__{color}{color:#de350b}&{color}{color:#4c9aff}__space__{color}_n_ letters
 * Valid examples: {color:#00875a}A{color}{color:#de350b}&{color}, {color:#00875a}A{color}{color:#de350b} &{color}, {color:#00875a}A{color}{color:#de350b}&{color}A, {color:#00875a}A{color}{color:#de350b} & {color}A

2. In a ticket, search for one of the Organizations created.
h3. Expected Results

The searched Organization returns correctly in the result list or returns when the complete name is searched.
h3. Actual Results

The searched Organization may be missing from the list or not be found when the entire name is searched.
 * {color:#00875a}A{color}{color:#de350b} & {color}C should be on the list, however, it is not found:
 !image-2021-05-21-14-42-46-613.png!

 * {color:#00875a}A{color}{color:#de350b} & {color}C is not found:
 !image-2021-05-21-14-43-05-073.png!

 * The {color:#00875a}A{color}{color:#de350b} & {color}C Organization exists in the instance:
 !image-2021-05-21-14-46-40-904.png!

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here if available.
fields.summary: When searching for Organizations, the ampersand (&) is not considered for the search(new issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time we can only run the scheduled trigger for a set of Jira issues using a JQL
h3. Suggested Solution

It will be a good idea to use the scheduled trigger for Insight objects using an IQL and then use the Edit object action to perform actions on a set of objects JSDCLOUD-10023 
 This was possible with the legacy Insight app

h3. Workaround
Check if the following article helps you achieve your use case scenario [Update Insight object status to expired using automation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/update-insight-object-status-to-expired-using-automation-1072219008.html]
fields.summary: Ability to use scheduled trigger for Insight objects with an IQL just like jira issues

fields.description:
Currently, in order to use that action you're required to have an Object trigger (created/updated/deleted).

It'd be very useful to have more options to it, for instance using with the "Lookup Object" action before the "Edit Object".

This would allow more possibilities, such as using the Incoming Webhook trigger to find and update an Object.
fields.summary: Add more options/functionalities to the "Edit Object" automation action

fields.description:
An incident should be automatically closed when all the associated alerts are closed in Opsgenie.
Basically, Incident closure should be configurable under the Incident Rules tab.
fields.summary: Automatic Opsgenie Incident closure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At the moment, when an Insight custom field added to a hidden request form, the field doesn't populate or list the objects. This is a problem when the admin would like to test the field behaviour before releasing the request form to public. And also [Create Request REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-request/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-post] request , failed too. The field only works after the request form not hidden.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create insight custom field and add to a request form
 # Set the request form hidden
# Test the insight custom field by searching the objects

h3. Expected Results
Object listed 

h3. Actual Results
No object listed to the field

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight custom field data not populating when request type are set to hidden

fields.description:
As a customer I want the alert description to handle HTML rendering and display HTML elements properly formatted. 

Currenlty, the data is displayed in the alert description in plain text format which shows the HTML tags.
fields.summary: HTML rendering in Opsgenie alert description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking the check all button does not select the requests in queue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a queue
 # Click on the check all checkbox

h3. Expected Results
All requests in the queue would be selected
h3. Actual Results
The checkbox does not respond

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Check all checkbox in the queue is not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, on Automation for Jira, there is a trigger to detect if an object in Insight has been updated, but there is no feature to detect the old value vs new value of the attribute change. The lack of this makes it not possible to configure an automation rule that triggers when an attribute is updated from one specific value to another.

It's also not possible to switch triggers on objects at the moment, so it's not possible to configure an automation rule that triggers a change on _another_ linked object when an object is updated.
fields.summary: Automations for Insight: Ability to set a trigger when a specific object attribute is changed from one specific value to another

fields.description:
Currently, there is no way to mute all notifications to reporter, participants, watchers on a per issue basis in JSM.
Customer notifications can be turned off at the project level or by a customer individually via their portal settings but not by an Admin on an ad-hoc basis at the issue level.

For comparison purposes, the open-source and free helpdesk management service: Spiceworks, offers this ability. 
You can select a specific ticket, choose to 'mute' it, and all email communications back and forth on that ticket will stop unless it is taken off mute.

There are several critical business process related reasons for this important functionality that cannot otherwise be accomplished with current Jira Service Management features.
fields.summary: Allow Notification Muting by Ticket/Issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there's no public API to retrieve information of Services under the operations menu of the ITSM service project.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a REST API to retrieve/export Services information from the service desk project.
h3. Why this is important

Admins would have spent a lot of time allocating services a tier and updating the descriptions. It would very helpful to export the information and use the information for documentation.
h3. Documentation:

[https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/]
fields.summary: Public REST API to retrieve Services information in ITSM service project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some pages (Overview pages and blog posts) are not working properly in KB articles. Instead of staying in the JSD KB page, those links would redirect the customer to the Confluence page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page and set this as the Overview page of a space and/or create a blog post
 # Render it in the KB view, by adding those links in a page in Confluence, so its clickable
 # Click it would redirect you to the Confluence page


h3. Expected Results
This should redirect you to the article in KB view in JSM
The customers should stay in JSM KB page

h3. Actual Results
Links redirect customers to the Confluence page

h3. Workaround
Only use links for regular pages (not blog posts or overview pages)
fields.summary: Overview pages and blog posts links, rendered in JSM view portal redirects to Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Queues are not translated when changing personal language and system language
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your profile language on https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
 # Change the site language on System > General configuration

h3. Expected Results

The entire instance is translated to the desired language
h3. Actual Results

Default and custom queues are not translated. 

If a new project is created by a user/admin, for example, when the profile and site are in Spanish, it will show queues and other information in Spanish, but if another user with the profile in English access the project, it will show the queues in Spanish (also the SLAs and Issue types are not translated to the current user language).

After changing the site and profile language from Spanish to English, the project previously created while the user was using another language, won’t be translated. 
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Queues are not translated when changing personal language and system language

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The page does not load when viewing Jira Issue status is "Waiting for approval"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- On a workflow with approvals, make sure that the approval step is linked to a custom user picker field (Not the default approver field)
- Create a new service request with approvals with the custom approver field filled in.

h3. Expected Results

TBD

h3. Actual Results

TBD
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
 Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: The Jira Issue View page does not load when Jira Issue status is "Waiting for approval"

fields.description:
Communications around an incident are currently restricted to Slack.

 

Please could this be expanded to other platforms, we currently use Microsoft Teams and would love to have a central place to communicate with internal teams around incidents.
fields.summary: Incident management is restricted to Slack in OpsGenie

fields.description:
Nowadays, it is only possible to see: * The number of views per article
 * how many times an article helped to solve a problem

It would also be interesting to have the possiblity to see the users (the clients of the portal) who saw this article
fields.summary: Report showing who has viewed a Knowledge article

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when the object type have more than 100 objects , user unable to filter issue using "Created" an "Updated" field. In network log , it response 504 error after 10s :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-05-20 at 1.15.10 pm.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object type
 # Add more than 100 objects
# At *Filter Search* , choose *Created* and set the date/time

h3. Expected Results
Successfully return the results

h3. Actual Results
No responses and at the Network logs show as below :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-05-20 at 1.15.10 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Export the object type and filter the object via Excel.
fields.summary: Unable to filter Insight object for Created and Updated field

fields.description:
Currently, there is a functionality to create Jira Software tickets from inside an Opsgenie alert. But this same feature does not exist for creating Jira Service Management tickets from inside an Opsgenie alert. We can only link JSM tickets, but not create them.

As a customer, I want the ability to create JSM tickets from inside an Opsgenie alert.
fields.summary: Feature to create a JSM ticket from inside an Opsgenie alert

fields.description:
h3. Description

At the moment, when creating tickets using the *Create* button, we can add users/customers who don't have access to the project in the Approvers field. However, these users will not receive the notification and will not be able to see this ticket.
h3. Suggestion

It would be very helpful if we couldn't be able to add to the Approvers field users/customers who don't have access to the project, since we wouldn't expect them to receive a notification for this event.
fields.summary: Don't show customers/users who don't have access to the project when adding approvers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, when the JSM Customer Portal set to public , customer will create issue as anonymous. As anonymous, users have no roles in the system, Insight Object custom field cannot show them the objects since they are not recognized as users by Insight. 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice to have the option to show allow anonymous user to select Insight Object from the Insight Object custom field type.

h3. Workaround

# Create a select list custom field and add all the objects as the data. 
# Then, create automation to update the Insight object custom field according the to custom field value.
fields.summary: As an Admin I want to allow anonymous user to be able to view and select options in an Insight Object custom field in the Help Center (Portal)

fields.description: Request for the ability to restrict access to services from projects.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict services to a single project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time when a cloud site has JSM premium, the customer can use Insight with the Jira software and Business projects with a few discrepancies. For example: 
 * Automation does not contain the Insight components

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow fully functional Insight features for Software and Business projects when the cloud site has JSM premium enabled
fields.summary: Allow fully functional Insight features for Software and Business projects with JSM premium

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Show More Fields" is visible in JSM project issue-view even when there are no fields present to display
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The issue view displays "Show 1 more field"
 # Click on it.

h3. Expected Results

The field should appear
h3. Actual Results

No fields are displayed as there are no fields to be shown

!Screen Recording 2021-05-19 at 12.04.20 PM.gif|width=262,height=222!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Show More Fields" is visible in JSM even when no fields are present

fields.description: Ex: Change a Contract Object's Status to "Expired" once the "Expiration Date" is overdue.
fields.summary: The ability to trigger Automations based on Insight Object attributes.

fields.description:
We have customers set up in organizations, so that they can see each other's tickets.  

It would be great if they could search for a ticket at the global search of the help center home page.  

As it is, they have to go to Requests, then select their organization (or "created by anyone) and any status and then enter the ticket #.
It should be easier than that.
fields.summary: Customer Portal global search for tickets

fields.description:
Currently, for Server/Data Center, we have an option to move one or more objects from one object type to another within the same object schema: [Move Objects|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/ICV71/Move+Objects]

This function helps to enable/disable inheritance using: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mPLTfsIJyVg

However, this function is not available in the Insight cloud.
fields.summary: Add the ability to move objects to another object type within object schema to Insight

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing Request Type from *Email Requests* to a custom request type (the request types that do not come by default and are added into the project post-project creation) is always redirecting to Move Issue screen even when the destination request types are having the same workflows and Field configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # On a next-gen project, create a request type that has the exact workflow and field configuration with email request.
 # Change the request type by click on the Issue Type Icon beside the Issue Key from 'Email Request' to the new request type above
 # When selecting another Issue type it redirects to the Move issue screen.

Note: This only occurs when the destination request type is a 'custom' one. Changing to a 'default' request type does not trigger the move screen, neither does changing from the custom request type to a 'default' request (or email request)

h3. Expected Results

If the request types have the same Workflow and field configurations, it has to change the Issue type directly without redirecting to the Move issue screen.

h3. Actual Results

In spite of having the same workflow are field configurations, it still redirects to the Move issue screen whenever an issue is moved FROM the 'Email Request' request type
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: On Team Managed (Next-Gen) service projects, changing request type from 'Email Request' to a custom request type always redirect to Move Issue screen
